episodes.synopsis: Margaret Wertheim leads a project to re-create the creatures of the coral reefs using a crochet technique invented by a mathematician.
episodes.title: Margaret Wertheim on the Beautiful Math of Coral

episodes.synopsis: Kevin Slavin argues that algorithms create and control our world. These computer programs determine everything from espionage tactics to architecture.
episodes.title: Kevin Slavin: How Algorithms Shape Our World

episodes.synopsis: Mathematician Ron Eglash shows that many aspects of African design -- architecture, art, even hair braiding -- are based on perfect fractal patterns.
episodes.title: Ron Eglash on African Fractals

episodes.synopsis: Physicist Geoffrey West finds that wealth, crime rate, walking speed and other aspects of a city are deduced from one number: the city's population.
episodes.title: Geoffrey West: The Surprising Math of Cities and Corporations

episodes.synopsis: Stephen Wolfram, creator of Mathematica, talks about his quest to make all knowledge computational -- able to be searched, processed and manipulated.
episodes.title: Stephen Wolfram: Computing a Theory of Everything

episodes.synopsis: Using raw data on violent events in the Iraq War, Sean Gourley finds a strong mathematical relationship linking the fatality and frequency of attacks.
episodes.title: Sean Gourley on the Mathematics of War

episodes.synopsis: Mathematics legend Benoit Mandelbrot explores the complexity of roughness, and how fractal math can find order in unknowably complicated patterns.
episodes.title: Benoit Mandelbrot: Fractals and the Art of Roughness

episodes.synopsis: From the spin of subatomic particles to a beautiful arabesque, the world turns on symmetry. Oxford mathematician Marcus du Sautoy offers a glimpse.
episodes.title: Marcus du Sautoy: Symmetry, Reality's Riddle

episodes.synopsis: Mathematician Steven Strogatz shows how flocks of creatures (birds, fireflies and fish) synchronize and act as a unit, when no one's giving orders.
episodes.title: Steven Strogatz on Sync

video.title: TEDTalks: Numbers Speak Louder than Words
video.synopsis: Mathemagical tricks abound in these TEDTalks. Count on being amazed as these speakers give a whirlwind tour of the world of numbers.
